Docs.summary: Options used to configure the feature flags to be parsed.

Docs.summary: The time after which the cached values of the feature flags expire. Must be greater than or equal to 1 second.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.Label : string with get, set

Docs.summary: The label that feature flags will be selected from.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.AzureAppConfiguration.FeatureManagement.FeatureFlagOptions Select(string featureFlagFilter, string labelFilter) cil managed
Public Function Select (featureFlagFilter As String, Optional labelFilter As String = "\0") As FeatureFlagOptions

Docs.param: The filter to apply to feature flag names when querying Azure App Configuration for feature flags. For example, you can select all feature flags that begin with "MyApp" by setting the featureflagFilter to "MyApp*". The characters asterisk (*), comma (,) and backslash (\) are reserved and must be escaped using a backslash (\). Built-in feature flag filter options: .

The label filter to apply when querying Azure App Configuration for feature flags. By default the null label will be used. Built-in label filter options: The characters asterisk (*) and comma (,) are not supported. Backslash (\) character is reserved and must be escaped using another backslash (\).
Docs.summary: Specify what feature flags to include in the configuration provider. can be called multiple times to include multiple sets of feature flags.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.AzureAppConfiguration.FeatureManagement.FeatureFlagOptions Select (string featureFlagFilter, string labelFilter = "\0", System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<string> tagFilters = default);

.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.AzureAppConfiguration.FeatureManagement.FeatureFlagOptions Select(string featureFlagFilter, string labelFilter, class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<string> tagFilters) cil managed
Public Function Select (featureFlagFilter As String, Optional labelFilter As String = "\0", Optional tagFilters As IEnumerable(Of String) = Nothing) As FeatureFlagOptions

Docs.param: The filter to apply to feature flag names when querying Azure App Configuration for feature flags. For example, you can select all feature flags that begin with "MyApp" by setting the featureflagFilter to "MyApp*". The characters asterisk (*), comma (,) and backslash (\) are reserved and must be escaped using a backslash (\). Built-in feature flag filter options: .

The label filter to apply when querying Azure App Configuration for feature flags. By default the null label will be used. Built-in label filter options: The characters asterisk (*) and comma (,) are not supported. Backslash (\) character is reserved and must be escaped using another backslash (\).

In addition to key and label filters, feature flags from Azure App Configuration can be filtered based on their tag names and values. Each tag filter must follow the format "tagName=tagValue". Only those feature flags will be loaded whose tags match all the tags provided here. Built in tag filter values: . For example, $"tagName={}". The characters asterisk (*), comma (,) and backslash (\) are reserved and must be escaped using a backslash (\). Up to 5 tag filters can be provided. If no tag filters are provided, feature flags will not be filtered based on tags.
Docs.summary: Specify what feature flags to include in the configuration provider. can be called multiple times to include multiple sets of feature flags.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.AzureAppConfiguration.FeatureManagement.FeatureFlagOptions SetRefreshInterval(valuetype System.TimeSpan refreshInterval) cil managed
Public Function SetRefreshInterval (refreshInterval As TimeSpan) As FeatureFlagOptions

Docs.param: Sets the minimum time interval between consecutive refresh operations for feature flags. Default value is 30 seconds. Must be greater than or equal to 1 second.
Docs.summary: Sets the time after which feature flags can be refreshed.
